channel.title: Negative and Positive Integers

item.title: Negative and Positive Integers
item.dc:creator: @The_Outsider The Outsider
item.description:
@The_Outsider wrote:

Thanks. Took me a couple of times to read and get my head round what you said but yes, it gives off what I want it to now. Changed a setting I had declared. I just needed to know if that was a valid statement, with a range of 198 (-99 to +99).

In my save/loading I was doing put.buf(int); and get.buf(unsigned); which wasn’t working obviously.

Read full topic

item.title: Negative and Positive Integers
item.dc:creator: @T41 t4
item.description:
@T41 wrote:

[quote=“The Outsider, post:1, topic:424651”]Say I want to do a check from -99 to 99. That’s a difference of 198.

public void getOrient(int NOMINATOR) {
		if ((NOMINATOR >= -99) && (NOMINATOR <= 99)) {

Is that a valid check using negative 99 to positive 99? Because I get the wrong result whilst using it. Does that give me a range from -99 to 0 to +99?[/quote]
If the integer is greater than or equal to -99, 1 is returned.
If the integer is less than or equal to 99, 1 is returned.
Result: 1 ^ 1 = 1.

In order for 1 to be the result of that boolean expression, both booleans in the expression must be 1 (true).

Read full topic

item.title: Negative and Positive Integers

item.description:
@The_Outsider wrote:

Say I want to do a check from -99 to 99. That’s a difference of 198.

public void getOrient(int NOMINATOR) {
		if ((NOMINATOR >= -99) && (NOMINATOR <= 99)) {

Is that a valid check using negative 99 to positive 99? Because I get the wrong result whilst using it. Does that give me a range from -99 to 0 to +99?

Read full topic
